Can't and won't/forgets to aren't the same.

You literally gain **nothing** from taking Aftershock on a champion that can't use proc it. There's no passive stats, the only time Aftershock has any effect is when it's procced. That is the line. 

You *only* benefit from having that rune swapped out, plain and simple. Even if you only manage to proc Grasp a single time that game and it was completely by accident, it's still done more for you than Aftershock would.

Depends on the champion you have used.
For example, if you used a rune page that contains the Presence of Mind rune, when you picked a manaless champion, as soon as you are in game, it will change to another rune because Presence of Mind is used to restore mana, and it cannot be used on a manaless champion.

If you used a rune page that contains the Aftershock keystone, and you picked Garen, it will change to another keystone because Aftershock are for heavy Crowd Control champions like Aatrox, Darius, etc. Garen does not have any ability to proc the Aftershock keystone.
